basics.name: Chiara Di Vece
basics.label: PhD Student in Computer Science
basics.summary: PhD Student specializing in Deep Learning, Deep Reinforcement Learning, and Image Analysis for healthcare.

location.address: University College London, Charles Bell House, 43-45 Foley St

work.name: University College London - Dept of Computer Science
work.summary: Development of a training system for autonomous navigation and guidance in freehand fetal ultrasound scans exploiting vision-based deep reinforcement learning. Collaboration with the Wellcome / EPSRC Centre for Interventional and Surgical Sciences (WEISS).

work.name: MathWorks - Deep Learning Algorithms
work.summary: Extended the Deep Learning Toolbox with the sort method, now supported by the Automatic Differentiation engine. The function can be used to build custom layers.

work.name: University College London - Dept of Computer Science
work.summary: Running coding lab sessions, Q/A sessions, homework/exams development and marking for courses like COMP0089: Reinforcement Learning, COMP0037: Robotic Systems, COMP0088: Introduction to Machine Learning, ENGF0003: Mathematical Modelling and Analysis 1.

work.name: Politecnico di Milano - Dept of Electronics, Information and Bioengineering
work.summary: Worked at the Neuroengineering and Medical Robotics Lab on the European project EDEN2020 for the development of a position-based dynamics simulator of brain deformations for path planning and intra-operative control in keyhole neurosurgery. Supervised MSc student on the thesis development involving KUKA robot and haptic interfaces for palpation procedures.

work.name: University of Illinois at Chicago - Dept of Bioengineering
work.summary: Ran exercise practice sessions, Q/A sessions, homework/exams marking for BME310: Biological Systems Analysis, covering system dynamics and frequency-domain analysis in bioengineering systems.

work.name: University of Illinois at Chicago - Dept of Urology & UIC Innovation Center
work.summary: Developed a novel haptic and virtual reality-based simulator for improvement of psychomotor skill in Veress needle insertion.

awards.title: Women’s health tech grant
awards.summary: Awarded £5000 for research on women's health technology.

awards.title: AURIS/IPCAI Young Investigator Travel Award
awards.summary: 1st place award for young investigator travel.

awards.title: MICCAI2022 Women in MICCAI Inspirational Leadership Legacy

awards.awarder: UCL Medical Image Computing Summer School (MedICSS)

awards.title: UCL Research Studentship
awards.summary: Research studentship in the Department of Computer Science.

awards.title: Rare Disease Hackathon
awards.summary: 1st place award at the Rare Disease Hackathon in Florence, Italy.

awards.title: Young Professional Demo Competition Event
awards.awarder: IEEE 3rd International Forum on Research and Technologies for Society and Industry Leveraging a better tomorrow (RTSI)

projects.name: 6D Pose Regression of Ultrasound Diagnostic Planes
projects.summary: Developed a regression CNN to predict the 6D pose (3D rotations and translations) of a plane in relation to the anatomy using image features and a Unity-based simulation environment for automatic acquisition of supervised synthetic data. Achieved reliable localization of US planes within the fetal brain in phantom data with a median error of 0.90 mm/1.17° and successful generalization of pose regression for an unseen real fetal brain.

projects.name: Simulation of Brain Deformations in Keyhole Neurosurgery
projects.summary: Developed a Unity-based realistic and time-bounded simulator that mocks brain deformations during keyhole surgical procedures. Validated using recorded deformation data of in-vivo animal trials, achieving a mean mismatch of 4.73±2.15%.

projects.name: Virtual Reality and Haptics for Surgical Skills Training
projects.summary: Developed a VR and haptic-based simulator for urological training in obtaining the pneumoperitoneum. Improved the acquisition of psychomotor skills and achieved a 'good' usability score in the System Usability Scale test with experienced clinicians.

volunteer.organization: Alta Scuola Politecnica Alumni Mentoring Program
volunteer.summary: ASP alumni (Mentors) accompany the ASP students (Mentees) in their final year of the Alta Scuola Politecnica in an individual path of growth, designed for the needs of each student. Mentors and students create a relationship of trust and mutual exchange, benefiting from a constructive and long-lasting interaction.

Joint honor program of Politecnico di Milano and Politecnico di Torino running in parallel with the MSc and based on merit. Developed a multidisciplinary project recognized as one of the three best projects of the cycle.

volunteer.organization: IEEE Women in Engineering Student Branch Affinity Group
volunteer.summary: Part of the executive board of one of the largest associations at PoliMi, managed social media pages, and organized networking events.

volunteer.organization: Professional Center of Academic Dance 'La Dance'
volunteer.summary: Obtained the Diploma in Ballet, modern and contemporary dance.
